title: "Sidechain written to disk" repeatedly
body:
We had a quirky issue on `baikal`. Baikal has three sealers, `geth`, `besu` and `nethermind`. One transaction was sent out, and picked up by `nethermind`. When `nethermind` included it in a block, the block became invalid, and was rejected by the others. 

However, `geth` and `besu` didn't pick up the transaction, so they kept mining empty blocks. And `nethermind` would switch over to the empty `canon` chain, and build another bad block on top. That kept repeating for a while, until I eventually got the transaction into block `14629`, which caused `nethermind` to finally drop off the canon chain. 

Now, my local geth node keeps printing these messages every time it imports a block: 

```
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.390] Sidechain written to disk                start=14606 end=14606 sidetd=27054 localtd=27271
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.390] Sidechain written to disk                start=14609 end=14609 sidetd=27057 localtd=27271
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.391] Sidechain written to disk                start=14612 end=14612 sidetd=27062 localtd=27271
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.391] Sidechain written to disk                start=14615 end=14615 sidetd=27065 localtd=27271
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.391] Sidechain written to disk                start=14618 end=14618 sidetd=27070 localtd=27271
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.391] Sidechain written to disk                start=14621 end=14621 sidetd=27073 localtd=27271

INFO [05-17|15:40:41.391] Sidechain written to disk                start=14629 end=14629 sidetd=27083 localtd=27271
INFO [05-17|15:40:41.392] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=0 mgas=0.000 elapsed="412.268Âµs" mgasps=0.000   number=14771 hash=068289..e091e6 dirty=20.93KiB



INFO [05-17|15:40:43.249] Looking for peers                        peercount=2 tried=103 static=0
```
